info.title: Azure Media Services
info.description: This Swagger was generated by the API Framework.

created.description: The creation date of the Asset.

lastModified.description: The last modified date of the Asset.

alternateId.description: The alternate ID of the Asset.

container.description: The name of the asset blob container.

storageAccountName.description: The name of the storage account.

values.description: The Asset does not use client-side storage encryption (this is the only allowed value for new Assets).
The Asset is encrypted with Media Services client-side encryption.

storageEncryptionFormat.description: The Asset encryption format. One of None or MediaStorageEncryption.

assetContainerSasUrls.description: The list of Asset container SAS URLs.

AssetContainerSas.description: The Asset Storage container SAS URLs.

AssetFileEncryptionMetadata.description: The Asset File Storage encryption metadata.

key.description: The Asset File storage encryption key.

StorageEncryptedAssetDecryptionData.description: Data needed to decrypt asset files encrypted with legacy storage encryption.

ListStreamingLocatorsResponse.description: The Streaming Locators associated with this Asset.

created.description: The creation time of the Streaming Locator.

startTime.description: The start time of the Streaming Locator.

endTime.description: The end time of the Streaming Locator.

streamingPolicyName.description: Name of the Streaming Policy used by this Streaming Locator.

defaultContentKeyPolicyName.description: Name of the default ContentKeyPolicy used by this Streaming Locator.

systemData.description: The system metadata relating to this resource.

presentationWindowDuration.description: The relative to end sliding window.

liveBackoffDuration.description: The relative to end right edge.

timescale.description: The time scale of time stamps.

forceEndTimestamp.description: The indicator of forcing existing of end time stamp.

PresentationTimeRange.description: The presentation time range, this is asset related and not recommended for Account Filter.

FilterTrackPropertyCondition.description: The class to specify one track property condition.

FilterTrackSelection.description: Representing a list of FilterTrackPropertyConditions to select a track.  The filters are combined using a logical AND operation.

systemData.description: The system metadata relating to this resource.

default.description: The default for the HLS setting.

forced.description: The forced for the HLS setting.

characteristics.description: The characteristics for the HLS setting.

HlsSettings.description: The HLS setting for a text track.

TrackBase.description: Base type for concrete track types. A derived type must be used to represent the Track.

AudioTrack.description: Represents an audio track in the asset.

VideoTrack.description: Represents a video track in the asset.

fileName.description: The file name to the source file. This file is located in the storage container of the asset.

displayName.description: The display name of the text track on a video player. In HLS, this maps to the NAME attribute of EXT-X-MEDIA.

languageCode.description: The RFC5646 language code for the text track.

values.description: The track is hidden to video player.
The track is visible to video player.

playerVisibility.description: When PlayerVisibility is set to "Visible", the text track will be present in the DASH manifest or HLS playlist when requested by a client. When the PlayerVisibility is set to "Hidden", the text will not be available to the client. The default value is "Visible".

hlsSettings.description: The HLS specific setting for the text track.

TextTrack.description: Represents a text track in an asset. A text track is usually used for sparse data related to the audio or video tracks.

track.description: Detailed information about a track in the asset.

provisioningState.description: Provisioning state of the asset track.

AssetTrackProperties.description: Properties of a video, audio or text track in the asset.

@odata.nextLink.description: A link to the next page of the collection (when the collection contains too many results to return in one response).

ListContainerSasInput.description: The parameters to the list SAS request.

permissions.description: The permissions to set on the SAS URL.

values.description: The SAS URL will allow read access to the container.
The SAS URL will allow read and write access to the container.
The SAS URL will allow read, write and delete access to the container.

expiryTime.description: The SAS URL expiration time.  This must be less than 24 hours from the current time.

@odata.nextLink.description: A link to the next page of the collection (when the collection contains too many results to return in one response).

get.description: List Assets in the Media Services account with optional filtering and ordering

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Restricts the set of items returned.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Specifies a non-negative integer n that limits the number of items returned from a collection. The service returns the number of available items up to but not greater than the specified value n.

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Specifies the key by which the result collection should be ordered.

get.description: Get the details of an Asset in the Media Services account

put.description: Creates or updates an Asset in the Media Services account

delete.description: Deletes an Asset in the Media Services account

patch.description: Updates an existing Asset in the Media Services account

post.description: Lists storage container URLs with shared access signatures (SAS) for uploading and downloading Asset content. The signatures are derived from the storage account keys.
Gets the Asset storage encryption keys used to decrypt content created by version 2 of the Media Services API
Lists Streaming Locators which are associated with this asset.

get.description: List Asset Filters associated with the specified Asset.
Get the details of an Asset Filter associated with the specified Asset.

put.summary: Create or update an Asset Filter
put.description: Creates or updates an Asset Filter associated with the specified Asset.

delete.description: Deletes an Asset Filter associated with the specified Asset.

patch.description: Updates an existing Asset Filter associated with the specified Asset.

get.description: Lists the Tracks in the asset
Get the details of a Track in the Asset

put.description: Create or update a Track in the asset

post.description: Update the track data. Call this API after any changes are made to the track data stored in the asset container. For example, you have modified the WebVTT captions file in the Azure blob storage container for the asset, viewers will not see the new version of the captions unless this API is called. Note, the changes may not be reflected immediately. CDN cache may also need to be purged if applicable.
